replies.body:
As a note, if you're looking to appeal the ban the best way to do so is by submitting a ticket to [Support](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us), explaining the situation and that you would like to appeal. They'll direct the ticket to the Player Behaviour team, at which point the case will be reviewed and a decision reached on the possibility of revoking the punishment. Keep in mind, there's no guarantee the ban will be revoked, as it is at Riot's discretion to do so.

That said, if you're willing to provide the chat logs (which you should have received via email and the in-client pop-up notifying you of your ban), there are a number of boards users who'll be happy to discuss it with you and address and specific comments that could have triggered the punishment.

I would like to take a moment to address this comment:
> i should be at least entitled to something seeing as i have put cash in since season 3 

Just to say that, there's no difference of treatment between paying and non-paying players. By spending money on the game, all you are paying for is RP, not any "superior treatment", especially in regards to the rules and punishment systems, which makes sense. Riot takes each player as being equal in the eyes of justice, regardless of amount of money spent, time played or dedication to the game.

I would also like to take a moment to state that quantity of reports against someone is never, in and of itself, enough to result in a punishment. My understanding is that reports against a single player from a pre-made group are treated as a single report, or at least weighted differently than multiple reports from randomly matched players, though I may be wrong on that.

If you have any questions, feel free to ask and I will attempt to answer them as accurately as possible.

This may have been an instance where 2 players who both have negative tendancies met in chat and triggered each other to blow up.
